intro: Palicourea rigida subsp. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy palicourea, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
